front.title: Update of Korean Character Encoding for Internet Messages

abstract.t: Since RFC 1557, which is a Korean character encoding for internet messages, was distributed in 1993, most mailers have been implemented using it. However, it's been reported many occurrences of incompatible transfer of Korean mail messages such as broken mail messages. Therefore certain features are need to be extended, and ambiguous contents must be clarified. This document updates RFC 1557 to resolve above matters. This memo provides information for the Internet community. This memo does not specify an Internet standard of any kind. Distribution of this memo is unlimited.
